artefact: Apply for a Bevin Boys veterans badge

artefact.overview: Get a veterans badge for Bevin Boys miners during World War 2 - eligibility, widows, application
artefact.body:
You can get a Bevin Boys veterans badge if you worked in the coal mines under the Bevin Boys scheme - widows of Bevin Boys can also apply.

Eligibility

You’ll get a badge if:

  • you worked in the mines under the Bevin Boys scheme between 1943 and 1948
  • you’re the widow of a Bevin Boy who died after 19 June, 2007

All Bevin Boys are eligible - it doesn’t matter if you volunteered or were a ‘ballotee’ (conscript).

How to apply

Download the application form and send it to the address on the form. There is no fee.

Download ‘Bevin Boys veterans badge application form’ (PDF, 73KB)

Read the ‘Bevin Boys badge Q&A’ or contact the Coal Liabilities Unit for help filling in the application.

Download ‘Bevin Boys badge Q&A’ (PDF, 140KB)

Coal Liabilities Unit
0300 068 5777

You can leave a message and you will be called back.

What happens next

You’ll get your badge around 4 to 6 weeks after sending in the application form.
